Name: Nightmare Cathedral: Nightmare Cat
Description:
GameFound Exclusive add on nightmare for Nightmare Cathedral.

Nightmare Cat adds a 9th nightmare to be mixed and matched with the 8 from the base game. Originally free to those who followed the campaign before launch, this was later an add on option for the campaign and not to be available in the very limited retail release that Nightmare Cathedral will see.

Name: Zuera
Description:
Are you good with words? And with your body? Can you say something to your friends without every single word necessary to?

Participate in the biggest Zuera (mockery) possible with this party game based on the popular game "Celebrities", but fully adapted to the Brazilian reality.

The game is played in three rounds. In the first, you can use whatever it takes to make your team figure out what's in the cards. In the second, only one word can be used. In the last one, just mimes. The laughter just builds up with each new round.

Whoever has collected the most points from the cards over the three rounds wins.

Name: Hex Chex
Description:
This game is an abstract strategy game. Consisting of hexagonal tiles arranged to form a much larger hexagon, and 18 moveable pieces.

This is a 2 player game where you can eliminate all your opponents' pieces or capture their starting tile. The game is played by taking turns moving pieces. Each player starts the game with 4 canons and 5 soldiers. The soldiers are restricted to walking and jumping forward. The canons can walk and jump in any direction. The canons also have the ability to launch a piece overtop of themselves to either get a soldier to go backwards by a space, or to crush an enemies piece. You can capture pieces by crushing them or jumping them.

Name: Artlink! Farnesina
Description:
Will you be able to collaboratively choose paintings and statues for a perfect exhibition, without knowing what themes the others have received?

In Artlink! Farnesina the players are called upon to set up exhibition routes with works from the Farnesina Collection based on certain themes, with varying degrees of difficulty. The aim of the game is to get the other contestants to guess the themes. ‘Artlink! Farnesina’ allows you to try your hand at the typical challenges of a curator’s work
Families: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Squary Movey
Description:
A Sudoku variant on a 9 x 9 spaces grid.
Players may move their pawn (numbered from 0 to 8) one space onto an adjacent vacant space, if in the column and row and 3 x 3 zone this number is not present yet. The player who first has 5 of his pawns in the indicated area (varies according to the number of players) wins. 
Variation 1: You must have 6 instead of 5 pawns in the designated area.
Variation 2: Throw the die to determine which pawn is to be moved.

Name: Majesty of Dragons
Description:
A competitive duel card strategy game for 2 players, where you will have to create an army of dragons in order to defeat your opponent by achieving one of the 5 different victory conditions the game offers. Gather dragon tribute, offer it to your favourite dragons and bring them to your side, unless your opponent offers more, triggering an auctioning mechanic. Manage your dragon tribute economy wisely, bid intelligently and don't over-spend too much. Keep your opponent's dragons in line, grow a magnificent dragon army and accumulate majesty points to win the game by the Majestic Victory. Or if you feel stronger, attack your opponent to cut off their strategy and even win the game by the Domination Victory.

There are 4 kinds of dragons, Chaos Dragons, Majestic Dragons, Primordial Dragons and Neutral Dragons, each with a special ability. To control their will, the Dragon Lords are at your orders. They will trigger combos and will offer different advantages.

The game consists on:

40 Dragons: Tarot size cards.
24 Progress cards: regular poker size cards.
24 Dragon Lords: regular poker size cards.
30 Dragon quests: regular poker size cards.
60 dragon tribute tokens: glass cabochons.
20 cardboard round punchout tokens.

In Majesty of Dragons, each game is different, as you have different goals and dragon combinations.

—description from the designer

Name: Death Roads: All Stars – Expansion 1: Goons and Guns
Description: The Goons and Guns expansion brings you 5 more drivers, a completely new mechanic of Sidekicks, 10 unique goons to hire as well as a heck load of new weapons including sonic weapons, a host of murder tools with new unique Status Effects like Net and Buildup, as well as a completely unique class of weapons with the Glitch mechanic!

Name: Death Roads: All Stars – Expansion 2: Riders in the Storm
Description: Riders in the Storm introduces 5 more drivable characters, additional guns with new acid and electric mechanics, and a new module of sponsors but mainly the weather module that will simulate harsh conditions of the Divided States of America ravaged by sandstorms and unpredictable weather phenomena.

Name: Death Roads: All Stars – Expansion 3: Power Up!
Description: The third bonus expansion created with the community during the Death Roads: All Stars Kickstarter campaign was an exclusive for those who supported the original campaign within the first 24 hours, or who signed up for the newsletter before the Kickstarter campaign launched.

Name: Nine Muses
Description:
Answer the call of the muses to earn your place in the history books as a great sage, leaving your rivals in the footnotes.

Nine Muses is a 2-4 player competitive card game where you can set yourself up to gain or steal humanity's most powerful resource: knowledge.

With the help of famous philosophers and the Nine Muses of Antiquity, you'll gather knowledge to gain points and put yourself ahead of the competition.

—description from the designer

Name: Flu Season Card Game
Description: A card game about staying healthy while eliminating others by getting them sick. Play cards against other players to cause them to lose heart tokens, the life tracking method for this game. Classes include Official, Rude Stranger, Introvert, and Scientist.

Name: BoozeQuest
Description:
BoozeQuest is a fantasy drinking game like few others! At its core, it plays as a classic roll and move board game, but it combines elements of turn based combat, special events at the end of rounds, a bit of role-playing to describe the action as it unfolds, and oh, yes—beer! Copious amounts of beer. This game is not for the faint of heart—or liver! To win, reach the top of the castle, defeat the evil Booze Dragon, and be the first to claim the Everlasting Keg!

—description from the publisher

Name: Al Casino 6 Black Hearts
Description:
This game has 5 turns as 1 round and repeats the rounds. Each time you repeat a round, the points of the curse written on the curse card will be added.

At the time of point calculation for each round, the player whose total curse points are 13 points or more loses the game. The player with the fewest curse points at that time wins the game. In adition, the player who wins all the curse cards by himself in one round wins the game. In this case, everyone except the winning player will be defeated.

Name: 12 Monks
Description:
This story takes place in the 12th century when Portugal was taking shape...

With his armies marching towards the south, Afonso Henriques, the King of Portugal, could not abandon the territory conquered from the Moors and decided to donate a huge plot of land in the center of the country (44,000 hectares) to a religious order of French origin called Cistercians. This community of monks, which had already settled in other regions, would have to manage the territory and resources of this place. In order to do that, an enormous monastery was built in Alcobaça and that same monastery would go on to become one of the most important for the Order.

The Cistercians' motto was Ora et Labora (prayer and work), so their abbeys were usually in secluded locations. Silence for their prayers was paramount, as was easy access to stone (in order to build the monastery) and several other goods, such as wood and iron (which were essential to build farming equipment and tools). Fertile land and access to water (necessary for food, hygiene, and agriculture) were also essential to achieve self-sufficiency. Alcobaça filled all the requirements for the task, so the Cistercians accepted the king's challenge — and this is the historical background from which this game was born.

12 Monks is a competitive game in which players emulate the mission given by the King to the Cistercians to manage and run the resources from the grounds of Alcobaça. Players will occupy this territory, produce and manufacture cultivated goods, extract the necessary resources to build the monastery of Alcobaça, and build the levada (that is, a system of aqueducts) that will give them access to fresh water.

—description from the designer

Name: Patient 0
Description:
Patient Zero is a strategic and very challenging game with a lot of player interaction and few simple rules. It’s a visual puzzle game that works with layers and has a strong and unusual table presence with chromatic combinations with an isometric and amorphous look (each turn the board will be reshaped and the board will always have different shapes from game-to-game).

The game uses tile laying, pattern recognition/building and area control mechanics to promote interesting decisions and cognitive work. It has a fast setup and a short game length.

SAMPLE #28 // MEDICAL REPORT

The sample was taken 12 days after the first symptoms. At the time the patient showed several symptoms and the infection was spreading throughout the lungs, stomach, liver and kidneys.

This game takes place inside a laboratory where each player will be a scientist working to discover a vaccine against a fast spreading virus discovered on patient zero. Time is of the essence and each player has to work on the taken sample (tile-laying on a common board) in order to fulfil the immune system’s demands (therapeutic objectives) and getting antibodies (Y disc) which are necessary to neutralize the antigen agent in each of the four affected organs.

—description from the designer

Name: Qube: Utan tvekan
Description: You get 10 questions in quick succession. And you must not answer yes, no, repeat the question or hesitate. The questions try to get you astray so it's easier said than done. At the slightest hesitation, your opponents throw themselves over the stopwatch. Collect cards by keeping your tongue straight in your mouth. Are you in?

Name: Qvalitetstid: Parforhold
Description:
Do you want to have fun and cozyness?
     Do you want to have great contact?
     Do you want more intimacy in your relationship? 


This quiz-game will strengthen you as a couple, and you certainly don't need to have problems to play the game. It's a tool to bring you closer together.

The 200 cards in 8 categories, will help you to get to know each other, and bring you closer, while you have fun, laugh, and develop your relations, and talk about subject that you might have forgotten in your day-to-day life.

Qvalitetstid - Parforhold is a quiz-game which is cozy and fun to play. You will closeness and more positive contact in your conversations, and your will have som real talks, which will give your a closer relationship, more intimacy and a greater understanding of each other.

The game is developed by couples-therpist Anna Østergaard and game-designer Jake Inlove.

Name: Wings of Glory: Pocket Travel Edition
Description:
Card-only version published on the issue #25 of the magazine IoGioco (April 2022). 3 maneuvre decks, 6 planes (to play in 6 with two copies), trenches and machine guns. Simplified combat rules and a range of scenarios. 100% compatible with all Wings of War and Wings of Glory sets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Yubitsume
Description:
Fingers off the dice! You only keep your fingers if you move them at the right moment. If you are late or if your paws are grabbing the wrong place, you will soon nolonger be able to pickle.

Osaka‘s yakuza bosses have a problem. Their people are rotting away, the lack of discipline is rampant. It cannot go on like this! After the latest scandal, it is finally time to act and apply the best practices. From now on the following applies: Yubitsume ... Every misconduct costs a finger.

Yubitsume means shortening of the fingers. Fortunately, this game is not like the original, in Japan. With Yubitsume, the yakuza have to snip themselves when they screw up. It follows a strict ritual: You cut off a finger joint in the same presence of the clan chief. If the boss is in a nasty mood, it can be a bit more. You repeat that until ... need we say more.

Even in the game Yubitsume, mistakes and inaction do not go unpunished. Whenever that happens normally with the yakuza, fingers come off, if you still have some to remove! But rest assured, everything runs more gently and - let‘s say more symbolically - in this game.

Name: Héroes y Mitos
Description: Thematic board game with mythological content.

Name: Ases del Estadio
Description:
Thematic game of Olympic Athletics.

Compete in 13 different disciplines of Olympic Athletics.

Name: Key Pai Sho
Description:
The first fan-made version of Pai Sho to accurately imitate the mysterious board game as it was portrayed in 'Avatar: The Last Airbender'. Key Pai Sho was created with the intention of simplifying and condensing the core elements of existing versions of the game, while simultaneously being able to accurately imitate every move played in the show.

In a battle of wits, two players compete to arrange flower tiles and create a ring of harmony around the centre of the board, all while disrupting their opponent's attempts through a variety of creative means. Using strategic thinking and a heavy dose of creativity, out-position your opponent and claim victory.

Harmonies form between Key Flower tiles, while Special Effect tiles are used to influence the board in varied and original ways. Select the effect tiles that best support your playstyle and invent unique and powerful combinations to surprise your opponent. The first player to create an uninterrupted chain of harmonies around the centre of the board wins.
Families: TV Shows: Avatar The Last Airbender/Legend of Korra

Name: Spitfire: The Fight for Air Supremacy
Description: Spitfire the fight for air supremacy, is a solitaire roll and write wargame. Putting the player in the cockpit of a Spitfire, belonging to 11 group during the Battle of Britain. The player will have to engage and destroy German fighters and try to reach German bombers before they drop their bombs on British airfields. The aim of the game is to protect British airfields and reduce German bomber production. The RAF are counting on you to take the fight to the skies beware the Hun in the sun. TALLY HO CHAPS
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)

Name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Class Pack
Description: Tanares introduces four new classes to the world. Get miniatures that represent each of them (including alternate genders and subclasses!). The box also comes with 8x Heropads and 32x Attack Cards that you can use to play the boardgames Arena: the Contest and Tanares Adventures.

Name: Casino Night Game
Description:
POG Casino night let’s you play all your favorite casino games POG style!
Casino War,Blackjack Attack, Texas Hold’em Poker and more.
You can even invent your own games with the 52 POG’s and 2 Jokers.

Name: Babel Bricks
Description:
A set of wooden blocks with engraved letters that can be played in a multitude of ways.

There are 100 wooden blocks with a letter engraved on each side. The letters are distributed throughout the game in line with common usage of the English language, plus two blank blocks.

A standard set of rules have been printed on the box to serve as a suggestion, but the game lends itself to players originating and adapting the rules as they wish to determine.

The standard rules suggest building the tower 5 blocks to a level, with 20 levels and players using dexterity, strategy and spelling skills to slide out blocks to find words to collect points to win.

Name: In The Shadow Of Jupiter
Description:
In The Shadow Of Jupiter is a 1-4 player cooperative resource management game set on four moons of Jupiter. 
The year is 2075. Earth is running out of resources. Countries and global corporations are growing desperate and have taken to the outer planets for a new source of energy to replace our dwindling reserves. A deep space probe discovers a new rare element in the lower troposphere of Jupiter which scientists name Exonium. This element will provide significant relief to the energy crisis on Earth. 
In a move to beat its competitors, the Power Dynamics Corporation (PDC) has decided to take matters into its own hands. PDC has built a large carrier spacecraft containing four drop ships and sufficient resources to initiate development of stations on four of the moons of Jupiter, Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto.

You and your fellow PDC teammates will serve as the Commanders of these moon stations. You will each strive to establish a base camp, build the necessary production facilities, and become self-sufficient all the while working with your fellow commanders to get the Orbital Platform running at full strength. The environment around Jupiter is an extremely hostile one. Radiation, magnetic storms, moon quakes, and uncounted quantities of small debris rain down on every moon within the Jovian system. Life on an inhospitable foreign moon can be dangerous, but if the human race is to survive, failure is not an option…….

Welcome to In the Shadow of Jupiter, a strategic co-op game where you and your fellow PDC colleagues will strive to build stations on the different moons of Jupiter and survive against the dangers of space long enough to complete construction on the orbital mining platform. You are up against the clock, you can only last for so long before running out of supplies!

—description from the designer

Name: Aeon Trespass: Odyssey – Onwards Odyssey
Description:
Onwards Odyssey is a new Storybook consisting of two mini-Cycles, one that takes place after Cycle I and another after Cycle II. These are not campaign extensions! They’re new, separate stories with a more relaxed feel – you’ve won the respective Cycle after all – now you can take a more leisurely approach to travel around the Map.

New special adventure hubs tell new, uplifting stories of people coming to grips with the ending of each of these Cycles. Mind you, there is still danger in the world, some brand new, but the way you approach it is different.

Along with the new stories come new rules. The aforementioned new Voyage rules that allow for a more relaxed pace, completely new rewards and penalties for adventures, and new thematic Battles.

As the Onwards Odyssey stories take place after the corresponding Cycle, you won’t be able to access normal Cycle hubs… but you will be able to experience some of the R&R, Dreams of Pharos and Inward Odyssey adventures you’ve missed.

To keep it interesting, there is a caveat to going on an Onwards Odyssey though! During normal play, once you cross from Cycle to Cycle, you base Argo stats replenish. No such luck with Onwards Odyssey! So, if you were running on empty and snatched victory out of the jaws of defeat at the last moment, you’ll be hard-pressed to rebuild your ship and crew before you move to Lakonia or Delphi.
Onwards Odyssey is more than 50k words of stories, rules, battles and secrets!

-description from the publisher

Name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Odyssey
Description: This seventh expansion is the biggest expansion yet for cosmic encounter. introduces a campaign mode, 30 new aliens, 12 "alternate timeline" aliens revising previous aliens, and adds new space stations, technology, and hazards. It also adds new features, such as lux and moons.

Name: Dice Flower
Description:
Get secateurs, flannel shirts, vases and… gray matter! Play as the owner of one of a kind flower shop! Manage, plan, plant, cut and create beautiful, colorful bouquets. Don’t let the flowers and your growing ambition wither, to get as many Happiness Points as possible and win the competition. Are you ready to meet the demands of an endless queue of customers? Play and see for yourself!

Rool & write game with:

     unique board layout in each game
     deep and strategic gameplay
     unique mechanics
     high replayability


—description from the designer

Name: La feria de Tristán
Description:
La feria de Tristán ("The Tristan Fair") is a competitive card game, where you will represent a fair walker trying to find everything you need for your shopping list (objectives). You will buy product cards, which will give you benefits and victory points at the end of the game. 
On a day of the Tristan Fair sudden events can happen that will modify the course of the game a little. Prices will change as the game progresses, becoming cheaper to buy at certain stalls, but keep in mind that other players will also compete for better prices. 
So try to go to the shopping stalls first, managing your money very well so as not to run out of it.

The goal of the game is to make the most points at the end of the game.
Each player will try to get product cards and will have to combine them with others, which will give them victory points, in different ways, at the end of the game.

Name: Scaffold
Description:
Scaffold is a drawless connection game played on the intersections of a square grid using stones (as in Go). Black is trying to connect N-S edges of the board, White E-W with an orthogonally connected group.

				
				
					DefinitionsGroup: Either a single stone (a group of one) or any number of stones of the same color connected through a continuous series of orthogonal adjacencies.

				
				
					PlayFirst player places a single black stone on any grid intersection, after which the second player decides which color they will play (pie rule). Players then alternate taking turns.

On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty point. Then, if possible, place a stone of your color on an empty point that is orthogonally adjacent to two groups of your color, and keep making such placements until no more are possible.

				
				
					AcknowledgmentsEvery one of the regular posters on the BGG Abstract Game forum could rightfully consider themselves a co-author of this game if they wished. I'm like a kid who built something (hopefully cool!) out of LEGO -- but they made the bricks. Thank you all for your generosity and brilliance.

Luis Bolaños Mures helped clarify the presentation of the rules - Thanks.

This game shares some similarities with Quadrex by Bill Taylor, although it was arrived at independently.

				
				
					Online PlayScaffold is one of the many games that can be played for free at mindsports.nl. You can find it in the ArenA here:

https://mindsports.nl/index.php/arena/scaffold/

I'd like to express my gratitude to Christian Freeling and Ed van Zon for making this possible.

You can now also play Scaffold at Abstract Play thanks to BGG users Striton and ypaul. You can find it here:

https://play.abstractplay.com/

				
				
					Creative Commons LicenseScaffold by Andrew Lannan is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

Please let me know if you do anything fun with Scaffold!

—description from the designer

Name: Pizza Dominoes
Description:
Includes: 56 triangular dominoes, full instructions!
Match the toppings!

To win the game, you must be the first one,to get rid of your domino pieces, with matching the same toppings side.

Are you out with same toppings and can't put? Then pull a new one!

Name: Four Score
Description:
Four Score injects a modern and strategic twist into a classic gaming mechanism. Players compete with wooden sticks to complete a line of four on both sides of the game board. Diagonal, horizontal or vertical will do the trick.  To be victorious in Four Score you will need a steady hand, a keen eye and a plan two steps ahead of your opponent.

Players take turns inserting wooden sticks through both sides of the game board, selecting which holes on either side as they play. Sticks can only be controlled from a players own side, not manipulated from within the game board.

The player who completes a line of four on both sides of the game board first is crowned the winner!

As games progress dexterity plays an increasing role. Dislodge a stick while attempting your move and your turn is over.

Name: CIFRA Code25
Description:
CIFRA is 2-players pure abstract strategy game on 5x5 flexible board.

Players take their turn alternately. During their play the player can move their own piece according to the moving rules. If a player moves their piece onto the tile which an opponent piece occupies, they can capture it like a Chess piece.  If player moves their piece onto the opposite side, the piece is a goal and fixed there. Both players can't move it nor capture it.

When all alive five pieces of any one of players are captured or goal, then game is over.

Name: Sabotør
Description:
A game about cooperation, bluffing and deception.

Sabotør ("Saboteur") is a game where good cooperation is the key to success! Together with your teammates, you must cross the Atlantic Ocean in a galleon, but there are secret saboteurs who have only one goal in mind: Make sure the ship never reaches its destination, without being revealed.

This is a game where it can be fatal to trust other players. A game where your best friends will never hesitate to throw you into the sea and where you still depend on working together to reach the goal.

One person is Captain, changing each turn, and everyone gets 2 action cards they can play any time. Each round good and bad cards are passed around, everyone removing 1 card secretly and the Captain reveals the 3 remaining cards. He rolls a dice and the ship only moves forward if the roll is higher than red cards. Provision is automatically depleted by 1 each round. Everyone can get more action cards, shooting eachother, making someone walk the plank, get fish for extra food and so on. Hopefully the ship reach the destination, so the Saboteurs doesn't win!

Name: Die Rad-Wettfahrt
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the player. The first player to reach space 57 wins the game.

The game was probably published in the 1920's.

—user summary

Name: Knockdown: Chilly – Business Pingwin
Description: What will the Penguin show us today? He showed himself in the Arena, trying to knock down his enemies! Will you make the Globetrotter from Etherfields a winner in a Great Tournament?

Name: Knockdown: Cleito – Queen of Atlantis
Description: The Queen of Atlantis does her best to rule over the Arena. Use the powers of the glorious Cleito from Lords of Hellas to knock down your enemies and become a winner in the Great Tournament!

Name: Ticket to Europe
Description:
Ticket to Europe is a socially engaged, cooperative role-playing board game for 1-4 people. The player assumes the role of a refugee traveling from Africa to Europe. The game portrays the reality of the smuggling world and confronts players with morally difficult choices.
As part of the documentation, the creators visited a refugee camp on the Greek island of Lesbos, in order to present the phenomenon of the migration crisis as accurately as possible.

Name: Santiago Campaign 1898
Description:
Santiago Campaign 1898 is a two-player simulation of the campaign for Santiago de Cuba, which historically ended in the surrender of all Spanish forces on the island.

Units are battalions and regiments. Each hex is 1.6 km across. Turns represent one day each. To win, the US player must conquer most objectives and force the sortie of the Spanish fleet before the Yellow Fever season sets in.

Paper Wars Magazine #102, January 2023

Name: Neues Luftballonspiel
Description:
The goal of the game is to rise 7000 m into the air and then land your balloon safely. Movement is determined by 3 dice. Two numbered dice determine the rise and descent of a balloon, whereas the letter die determines movement to the left or right.
On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a balloon rises above 6300 m it risks its passengers freezing to death or the balloon blowing up.

The first player to safely land his balloon wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Discipline ～ジェレミア魔法学校の3年間～
Description:
Discipline: 3 Years at Jeremiah School of Magic is a cooperative game where players take on the role of new instructors at the prestigious Jeremiah School of Magic.  Over the course of three years, they work to balance each student's needs, provide encouragement, and help them graduate.  Should one instructor ever find themselves a bit overwhelmed, they can call on their co-workers for a helping hand.

After choosing from one of the four classes, players receive the corresponding event chart, seat number deck, and student cards.  The students are shuffled and randomly placed in a 3x4 grid, which forms the seating chart for the room.  Then seat number cards are drawn to determine the initial placement of power and negative markers.

Play proceeds through a series of lesson rounds, both group and individual ones.  Instructors try to balance encouragement and enthusiasm via the movement of power markers while slowing or outright eliminating the stress and frustration from the negative markers.  Should a student ever accumulate enough stress, they can spread it to others around them or even become absent.

At the close of three years, students are subject to a final exam.  After that, those that are absent or lack at least one power marker fail to graduate.  Teachers are then provided with a title and evaluation based on their work.  If too many students fail to pass, all the instructors are also seen as failures and lose.

Name: Kangchenjunga
Description:
Kangchenjunga is a game for two to five players aged 7+ which takes 15 to 20 minutes to play. Based on the epic 1930 Himalayan adventure which ultimately failed to climb the third highest peak in the world, the game uses original photos and draws on Frank Smythe's book The Kangchenjunga Adventure, written almost 100 years ago.

In the first part of the game the players recruit climbers and sherpas, and gather a range of other resources. These are all represented on the cards. This calls for a mixture of set-building and push-your-luck, as you aim to bring together the strongest expedition possible. Although the game is competitive, there are ways of helping each other too.

The second part of the game sees the players making their final preparations for an assault on the summit of Kangchenjunga. Some cards may not be useable if the set isn't correct. Then the summit attempt begins and players take it in turns to advance up the mountain. Kangchenjunga is 28,156 feet tall, and successful players must achieve this. But whatever the outcome, details of the players' expeditions can be recorded in the 'Hall of Fame' at the back of the Almanac.

Kangchenjunga works beautifully as a 'filler' game for a wide range of ages. Simple to learn, the game-play has surprising depths and re-playability is high. See the Rulebook and Almanac link below for full details of how the game plays.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ya-La-Vi
Description:
Ideal for family play and easy to play alone between childhoods. Between 2 cards… Which image is repeated??? mmmm… I ALREADY SAW IT!

You have to say it quickly, as soon as you found the match. The more attention you have, the easier you will see them! Hurry up, concentrate, wake up because in this game, speed rushes us and fun awaits us. If you take two cards and look closely, you will see that they always have one image in common (one and only one). So the goal of the game (in its 5 variants) is to find that common image between two cards and name them as quickly as possible.

1- Pile, Pile with challenges!
A card with images is distributed to each participant and the rest are placed in a pile in the center, with the images visible. You must look for the common image between the card that touched you and the first of the stack. Whoever names the match first draws the center card and places it on top of their own pile. when a challenge card appears, whoever meets it first wins the indicated cards. The game ends when there are no more cards in the center of the table and whoever collects the most cards wins.

2- Discard with challenges!
Opposite of "Stack, stack": a card is placed in the center of the table and the rest are distributed among those who play. Each participant has to find the common image between the card that is on the table and the first of their stack. When the match is found, it quickly drops it on the table, discarding itself. Whoever runs out of cards first wins. In this variant they also play the 4 challenge cards, each time a participant reveals one of these cards, they must read it aloud to the rest... So everyone participates!

3- The jersey (without challenges)
In the center of the table 9 cards are placed face up. The jersey is assembled by finding the same image on three different cards. Whoever forms them first and names the image that matches, takes all three cards (which must be replaced so that there are always 9 cards on the table). Once the cards are finished, whoever collected the most wins.

4- Take it yourself! (no challenges)
Each participant receives a card face down. The remaining cards are placed in a stack face up in the center of the table. Each participant has to find the common image between the card of the center and that of any participant (except their own). When the match is found, give the center card to whoever has the card with the match. Whoever keeps the most cards loses.

5- Pass it fast! (no challenges)
Each participant puts a card on the palm of his hand, in view of the rest. When someone finds the image in common between one card and another, he puts his own card on the matching card. Here nobody wins, but whoever keeps all the cards at the end loses.

Name: Operation Praying Mantis, April 18 1988
Description:
“Time is now against Iran.” –Chairman and de facto commander-in-chief, Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani’s comment following Operation Praying Mantis.

Following the destruction of Iran Air Flight 655 by the US, fully loaded with pilgrims on their way to Mecca for the Haj, the Iranian military vowed revenge against the “Great Satan”. With Grand Ayatollah Khomeni gravely ill, there was no one in charge within the Iranian government or military who could or would thwart this dangerous escalation of force. On April 14 the FFG (guided missile frigate) USS Samuel Roberts struck a mine at the edge of the international maritime channel near the Gulf of Bahrain while escorting a fleet of oil tankers. While no one aboard the stricken vessel was killed or seriously injured, the mine blew a gaping twenty-foot wide hole in the ship. Only the quick and skilled action by its crew kept USS Samuel Roberts from sinking. It was quickly determined by investigators that the Iranians had deployed the mines, and National Security Advisor, General Colin Powell advised President Reagan that a massive demonstration of force was required to demonstrate once and for all that Iranian armed interference with the flow of ship traffic in the Persian Gulf would not be tolerated.

Operation Praying Mantis was the largest US fleet action since the Second World War. While the US had a preponderance of force, any error or serious loss could possibly embolden the Iranians, especially the hard liners who resisted any end to the war with Iraq or compromise with the US-led coalition that opposed them. Operation Praying Mantis is a solitaire play game with the active player taking on the role of the commander of the US naval force charged with implementing the operation. The game’s rules govern the Iranian response. Can you do as well or better?

Each copy of Operation Praying Mantis is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch map
112 single-sided, unmounted counters
One player's aid sheet
6 pages of rules

Players will also need a six-sided die and one standard deck of playing cards to play the game. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards, has rules reminders on pertinent cards, and features graphics by Bruce Yearian is available from High Flying Dice Games.

—description from the designer

Name: Conquest
Description:
“Conquest” dates back to the 19th century and is one of the many games inspired by Checkers and Chess and which are also inspired by real historical episodes, such as battles, sieges, military events; among these games we remember “Asalto”, “Assault” and “Siege of Paris”. The game is developed on a 9x9 chessboard; each player has eight Soldiers and a King, initially arranged in the 3x3 lower right and upper left areas; the King is placed in the center of these areas and is completely surrounded by the eight Soldiers. The goal of the game is to conquer the Fortress, which is the 3x3 area in the center of the game board. 
Information on this game is not readily available: it is mentioned in “Il Grande Manuale dei Giochi da Tavolo” by Giuseppe Meroni and Aldo Spinelli (1996).

Name: Glow Spotters
Description:
The Glow Spotters Troop is on a nature adventure, trying to count fireflies to earn their Firefly badges. Each player has a set of firefly boards numbered 1 to 10. Players roll the die and collect various shaped Glow Tiles to reach the sum of fireflies on their boards. The first player to complete all their boards wins the game and receives their Firefly badge.

Skills Focus :  Addition,  Spatial Reasoning

—description from the publisher

Name: Casting Shadows: The Ice Storm Expansion
Description:
The 5-6 player expansion pack adds 2 new characters, 3 new locations, new spells/counterspells/companions, and some new mechanics into the game (in particular, freeze and stun status effects, which is why it comes with status effect tokens). It does let you expand the game for up to 6 people, but the 2 new characters and hex tiles can still be used even instead of characters and hex tiles from the base game even if you're playing with fewer people.

The Freeze status effect prevents an enemy from using the Travel action on their next turn

The Stun status effect reduces the number of resource dice an enemy gets to roll on their next turn.

Name: Casting Shadows: Lucky Skipper / Lucky the Unstable Player Board
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive "Lucky Skipper" / "Lucky the Unstable" Character Player Board and meeples. This was free to backers of previous campaigns and available as an add-on.

Lucky Skipper
"Spend 3 Shadow Energy to transform into Shadow Form."
/Lucky the Unstable
"Spend 2 Shadow Energy to move your Character from your current Hex tile to any Hex tile on the Map OR Spend 4 Shadow Energy to add the top card from the Main deck to your Spell Book."

Name: 2099: Solar Expansion
Description:
Stardate 1800, five years after the first permanent human settlement on Mars. Regular trade routes are established between the inner planets, and the spaceports grow into major cities. Helium-3 mined from the ice giants becomes our most valuable resource, as fusion reactors become the radiant heart of the asteroid-cities far from the warming rays of our sun. Meanwhile, a shadow economy is growing stronger. Space pirates patrol the inky void, employing new versions of classic tactics.

2099: Solar Expansion is a space-themed 18xx game with simple navigation and complex corruption.

Three tiers of operating company (private miners, pirates, and full-cap public) provide creative embezzling opportunities and increase player interactivity. Pirates run protection rackets to benefit themselves (and occasionally the businesses they protect), while the minor companies are pocket-to-pocket cash delivery missiles.

This game borrows the East Asia Expansion engine.

—description from the designer

Name: Hunt a Killer: Empty Faces – The Woods
Description:
We know you can solve a murder, but what happens when evil forces are at play? Experience Hunt A Killer in a completely new way! Try your hand at paranormal investigations with a full box set Empty Faces: The Woods. Fight against the supernatural forces of witchcraft and ancient evils to uncover the truth before it is too late.

The Woods takes place over 5 episodes (that's 20-30 hours of gameplay total!)

Take on the investigations alone, as a couple, or use it as the centerpiece for a terrifying game night.

Immerse yourself in the supernatural world of Empty Faces. Discover clues, decode ciphers, and solve puzzles to unravel the mystery. It's like an escape room delivered to your door!

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium

Name: Uh Oh! at home
Description:
Uh Oh!  What's going to happen? 
 Turn over the cards to discover cheeky surprises in this educational card game created for babies (yes, babies!), toddlers and up!

With 8 different ways to play, little ones can explore the concept of consequences, build puzzles, find objects, play memory games and more!  Each card is illustrated by Parker Jacobs (designer behind the preschool hit Yo Gabba Gabba!) into 4 familiar rooms (kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and garden) giving you new ways to bond with your children.

Uh Oh! at home is the second game in a range of card games designed to grow with your family. The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

8 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players aged 0 to 4+. (6 are co-operative, 2 competitive.) The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made from FSC card in the UK. (Single use plastic free and Carbon Balanced with the World Land Trust.)

—description from designer

Name: Schmuggler und Grenzwächter
Description:
One player has 7 red pawns (smugglers), which start on the spaces marked with an "A" and has to to cross the border and escape by leaving the game board via one of the spaces marked with a "C". For every escaped smuggler the player is awarded points.

The other player has 4 green pawns (border patrol) on one side of the border and 3 blue pawns on the other side. He has to prevent the smugglers to reach their goal. Members of the border patrol are not allowed to cross the border, but they may occupy spaces on the border.

Movement is one space for one pawn per turn. If a pawn gets on a space with is connected to a space which is already occupied by an enemy pawn, ist is lost and eliminated from the game and the enemy takes it's place.

After a second game with reversed roles the player with the most points is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Affen-Theater
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Sometimes the player has to take a detour. The first to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Obscure Battles 3: Drone Commander
Description:
In Obscure Battles Volume 3 – Drone Commander, the player takes the role of a Drone Operator trying to locate and destroy enemy assets using one of the Drone Types available to player.

Unlike the other Obscure Battle Series this game is exclusively solitaire: you don’t need any other player to play the game.

Using the game rules and supplied drone, loadout, target and threat cards you can design your own drone missions !
When loading your drone, you can choose from the current set of available loadouts. Once you are airborne you also have to keep an eye on the important items such as fuel and comms and also making sure that you are not shot out of the sky.

Game comes with 2 Drones and their loadouts you can use. More drone types and loadouts are provided as part of the optional packs.

A Milk run Scenario and one U.N. peacekeeping action sample campaign is included and more is to be released along as Scenario Packs based on the current event).

Your targets are selected from a different decks of cards such VIPs figures such as Terror leaders, Warlords, Several Tank Types, Camoufledged Bunkers to take with earth penetrators, Trucks and SAMS to shoot with smart  ammo using the option base and the optional extension packs provided.

Your drone will not be safe out there: there are several "well known figures" such as S400, Pantsir, Shilka, TOR, BUK, OSA SAMs, Igla and Stinger MANPADs, archaic ZU-23 Guns and even small arms (some of them are supplied on extension packs).

Your Drone can suffer malfunctions, or shot at by different threat vectors such as AA Guns,MANPADs, SAMs, Fighter Jets or even Laser guns such as Nazar...

Name: Guano! Guano!! Guano!!!
Description:
Based in 19th century American history, Guano! Guano!! Guano!!! takes players from the excrement-laden islands in the Pacific to the mansions of Newport, Rhode Island. Are you a philanthropist, an investor, or a social climber? To reach your goals, you'll have to discover new guano sources, ship it (by land or sea) to warehouses, and find the right buyers. Weather the storms, beat the competition, and enjoy the most ostentatious pastimes of the Gilded Age.

Players start with a small fleet on the way to building their guano empire.  On each turn they place workers and ships to explore islands and take guano to various markets (ports).  As their empire grows, players build bigger fleets and then spend their profits on luxuries of the Gilded Age.

—description from the publisher

Name: Web Weavers
Description:
Today, cheeky Walli and her friends are spinning big and beautiful webs. They‘re hoping for lots of juicy bugs. But what‘s that? The webs caught several treats but no bugs at all. Who would have thought it? They‘re even better than bugs! Help Walli and her friends crawl to the treats. But watch out - the spider thread gets shorter and shorter until finally the spider simply can‘t go any further.

After rolling the die to show one of 6 treats, everyone simultaneously guides their spider‘s thread through the opening of the spider web which shows the rolled treat. As soon as you cannot wind your spider through the required opening, you are out of the game. Last spider in the game wins.

Name: Stratira Königshalma Turm
Description:
A compilation of 3 games in a wooden box, cover and bottom showing 2 of 3 boards. In addition, there is a board for Nine Men's Morris.
Components: 2 x 48 wooden blocks

Stratira: Very close to  Score Four. Scoring is different as you may continue after having 4 in a row to get a better score. Details of the rules in BGG Weblink.

Königshalma: Very close to Halma. Played on a chess board (inside and outside of the box). Necessary components: King, 2 rooks and 7 pawns in 2 colors of a chess game (not provided). 2 x 6 standard pawns (of draughts e.g.) for the 4 player game needed. The blocks of the game could do well. (Not applicable for 3 players.)
The rules for 2 players are a mix of Halma and Salta as the pawns are to be moved to their mirror space at the other end of the board. The rules say you cannot change the color of the space because otherwise it would be impossible to enter the finish spaces (which is hard to believe).

Turm: Very close to Checkers. Played on a chess board (inside and outside of the box). Start: First row is empty, the next 2 rows have all spaces occupied. Moving is forwards and sidewards only. At the finish line, the pawn will be upgraded to a "Turm", like a "King" in Checkers.

Estimated year: 1990

—user summary

Name: Ancedale's Hope
Description:
Ancedale's Hope is a print & play game for single player linking survival mechanics and science fiction universe. Survive during expeditions on an island city and return to your HQ to produce the cure to fight a dangerous virus. Survive expeditions across a hostile island city. Return to your HQ to make the cure. Ancedale's Hope is a printable game. To play it, all you need is a pencil, an eraser and 5 dice. Ideally 4 of them will be of the same color, the 5th will be of a different color.

How to play ?

Your HQ is located in a safe place near Ancedale. In this base of operations, you will create the cure by validating various objectives, prepare your expeditions but also spend your money and experience points on permanent improvements.

In Ancedale's Hope, expeditions are at the heart of the game. But beware, your time is limited, you only have 10 days to find resources, complete the various objectives and finally evacuate the island before the virus infects you too.

An expedition consists of 3 steps:


     First: roll the single colored dice to find out the position of arrival on the island. Then roll 2x all 4 dice of the same color to determine the strength of the island's watchtowers 
     How a day unfolds: At the beginning of each day, during your expedition, roll all 5 dice. The single colored dice will determine the direction of the watchtower's view. The 4 dice of the same color will be used for your movements and for the items collected during that day. Simply note your movement on the map and mark the areas you have searched. At the end of the day you should have enough resources (food and water). In some cases you will also need to find a warm place to shelter from the cold before nightfall. If not, your health will be diminished. 
     At the end of an expedition: this one can be a real success or an abject failure. Fail and you will lose all the resources collected during the expedition. Succeed and you can bring them back to the safety of your HQ.

Name: Pam pam pam
Description:
Playful maths

We have created a board game that bridges the gap between school and home activities, and between learning and playing. It provides transition between age groups and people with different abilities.

It takes you from childhood to old age. It helps to move from playing alone, through playing doubles, to playing in teams. It can help children with autism to start talking. And it’s as diverse as autism.

The clarity and comprehensibility of shapes, colours and numbers can calm you down when competing.

Pam Pam Pam board game is built on values.
Pam Pam Pam rules of the game:

Pam Pam Pam is a board game in which players must find two identical symbols on the cards of a selected deck, place the colour, shape and value discs on the solution strip, and then place the solution strip next to the draw deck and name the discs.

In each deck, on each of two cards, there is only one symbol of the same colour, shape and value. A symbol is designated by colour, shape and value. The value is expressed by a number. The size of the symbols does not matter.
How the game works:

1. Players are given the basic tools.

2. Each player is dealt a card.

3. The remaining cards are placed face up in the middle. This will be the draw deck.

4. Players try to find two identical symbols on the newest card of their deck and the top card of the draw deck.

5. The first player who

a) places the discs of the correct colour, shape and value on the solution strip,

b) places it next to the draw deck,

c) names all three discs,

d) which are checked by another player, and if he/she judges them to be correct,

e) then the first player puts the discs from his/her solution strip back on the disc tray,

f) finally, he/she can pick up the card,

g) which he/she adds to his/her own cards.

If the solution is incorrect, the player takes back his /her solution strip and the round continues.

6. The game continues until all cards from the draw deck are used up.
Winner of the game:

Winner of the game is the player who has collected most of the cards.
A symbol consists of:

A colour: brown, blue, purple, red, pink, yellow, grey, green,

A shape: square, triangle, circle,

A value, e.g.: Arabic numeral, dot, finger, Roman numeral, number of two parts, a part of a number, mirrored number, vehicle, shape, letters, binary system, value of chess pieces, number of protons, number of legs of animals, combinations of these.

Name: Xeonia
Description:
Xeonia is an exciting fun anime-themed tabletop card game for 2-4 players that makes use of fast paced actions, skills, abilities, and powerful Assists to aid in becoming the champion of Xeonia!

â€‹Play as a standalone game in a PVP (Player vs Player) game mode, or in a co-operative story campaign.

â€‹My goal for Xeonia was to create a game that would engage the player into various combos, attacks, and skills. As I have played various card games myself, I took the ideas that stood out to me and have made them my own. With so many different combinations, the possibilities are endless.

—description from the designer

Name: Vivir para contarlo
Description:
Live to tell the tale is a competitive card game, in which you must come in second place to win the game.
You will represent a member of the royal council who must have knowledge of botany, politics, influences with the guilds and inhabitants of the city to achieve his best strategy, but without being the best.
The object of the game is to be the player with the second highest score.
For this, each player will start with 7 cards that will run out as the game progresses. These cards have a value from 0 to 7, they are of different suits, they contain various bonuses and in each round all players must reveal a card in their playing area.
In each round, through a draft of cards, the current starting player will decide how many cards should be passed, until the cards are finished.

Name: Guess The Fake junior
Description:
1000 amazing statements. Which is true and which is false? It’s exciting who knows what the whole family knows. Is the highly successful True or False back? board game with another release - specifically for kids! Do you believe everything? Now it turns out who is the smartest!
In the special quiz-show board game, you will hear statements from the funny presenter, and you will have to decide whether the statement is true or false. If your answer is correct, the master will reward you with a point, but if you guessed wrong, a "reward" will be deducted. The game gets twisted from round to round, so it always stays exciting and fun. Is it True or False? There are a total of 1,000 amazing statements in the memory of Junior Board Game. The game can be played by up to 5 players, but can also be practiced alone. It’s also perfect for traveling, as all you need is a star-shaped toy. Works with 3 R6 (AA) batteries included in the box.

Name: Win-Win Island
Description:
Win-Win Island is a mostly co-operative board game, where win-win deals are the key to victory!

While playing you are swept away to a beautiful island. Where more than one of you, or even all of you might win.

Each player has just been elected the leader or their town, and their goal is to make the lives of their friends and neighbors better by improving their village's standard of living, thus proving to be a leader worthy of support.

Thanks to the win-win dynamics built into the design of this game, you will find yourself able to cheer FOR your fellow players, while trading with them.

You will build your town, explore your island, help your people, and maybe even get re-elected as leader of your village.

This game was designed to allow you to play a different way with the people you love and support in real life. You can happily support them while playing too, because it is often good for you when good things happen for the other players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Szuper Farmer Midi
Description: With the Super Farmer Midi board game, you have the opportunity to gain an insight into the life of a farm, find out what the work of farmers really is, along with the pros and cons. You can increase the number of your flock simply by rolling the dice, but you have to be on the lookout all the way because the wolf is lurking around them and can grab one of them at any time. Swap each other to collect farm animals, get at least one of each species, and become the Super Farmer! The set includes 1 rules of the game, 2 twelve-sided dice, and 128 animal pictures.

Name: BrainBox: First animals
Description: Find out as much as you can about the animals! The BrainBox - First Animals board game is a quiz game that can be played alone and by many, where everything revolves around animals. During the game, you need to draw a card and memorize as many things as possible about it. The answers on the back of the cards need to be answered correctly, and whoever knows most of the questions correctly can put the card away! The Brain Box - First Animals contains a wealth of information about animals that even younger ones can easily learn!

Name: Gockola
Description: Gockola is a fun board game in the yard of Gerzson Farm with lots and lots of pets. Everyone gets three stables and a deck of cards. Players flip through the animal cards at once and then knock down the cards they want to get ahead of each other. The goal is to be the first to populate the stables. Caution! There can only be one male in a barn and one or more females of the same species! Unwanted animals can be transported by truck, but if someone gets a faulty cow or a flying horse into their barn, they are in trouble because their animals are running away.

Name: Bairs of the Radiant Realm
Description:
Bairs of the Radiant Realm is a two player dice placement game, where you take on the role of one of the Bears of the Air. Always looking to fly higher, further and faster, you are working to build a new aircraft. You will fly your wonderous machine across the Radiant Realm, helping its inhabitants, who will then help you in return by giving you resources or special abilities to build your new flying wonder

Developed as part of the 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

—description from the designer

Name: Superclub: Top Six Expansion Pack
Description: More players, more managers, more everything. With the Superclub expansion, Top Six, expand your game for the ultimate experience. Discover purple utility players that can play multiple positions equally well, super talents that can be developed from 1 to 6 stars, two brand new clubs that allow you to play 6 at a time, and much more. Superclub expansion requires base game to play, skills to win, and nothing more than a pulse to thoroughly enjoy.

Name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Character Pack
Description: Featuring the 4 new species (Taii’maku, Cirrus, Gloomfolk, Kemet), a Lost Magic Researcher (Kelanyah, the Wizard), and M’bollo, a Courage Domain Cleric, complete the Adventure Team introduced in the sample and play in any scenario with highly-detailed miniatures. The box also comes with new Item Cards for Tanares Adventures to represent each race’s signature equipment, and more!

Name: Superclub: Arsenal 2021/22
Description: Arsenal join the competition, finally allowing you to take charge of your favorite team in a game of Superclub! Scout, sign and develop all your favorite players as you try to maneuver the Gunners up the table in search of the coveted 100-points season.

Name: Superclub: Man City 2021/22
Description: Reigning Premier League champions Manchester City join the Superclub competition. Have fun scouting, signing and developing all your favorite players in direct competition with your closest rivals. Can you replicate what the Citizens achieved in 2017/18 by masterminding a Superclub worthy 100-points season? Only time will tell.

Name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Villain Pack
Description: Tanares is home to powerful monsters and intelligent villains who have been executing their nefarious plans for centuries. Find several of them and their gold-sized Villain/Overlord Cards, containing instructions, abilities, and Stats related to the missions from Arena: the Contest’s Epic Campaign, in this pack.

Name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Penumbral Pack
Description: The Penumbral Plane is one of Tanares's signature environments, a dark mirror of reality, where the most horrific Tanarean aberrations dwell, embodying dark emotions and negative thoughts. Face the powerful, huge penumbral dragon in Adventure in the Realms of Madness or join his side on Dragon Collection's Boss v Boss Game Mode. The monsters all come with stat block cards and are tne most powerful villains we've designed for Tanares Adventures, as you'll face them in the new (Epic) campaign arc.

Name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Mystical Pack
Description: Get two new Heroes (Emperor and Harun), Assets, and representatives of our new Simple Classes!

Name: Arena: The Contest – The Gold Dragon
Description: Get the masterfully-sculpted GARGANTUAN miniature of Isendden, the Gold Dragon! The box + tray also includes a Bosspad, Talisman Card, and 5x Attack Cards to play the Dragon Collection's Boss v Boss Game Mode.

Name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Dread, The First Ungod
Description: One of the most powerful monsters of Tanares RPG world, this Ungod is the final Boss of Time Twist Epic Level Boardgame Campaign Expansion for Tanares Adventures; your encounter with it is one of the most difficult challenges Dragori Games has conceived, not recommended for the faint of heart! -text from publisher

Name: Joking Hazard: Dating Hazard
Description: A Joking Hazard 10-card pack expansion available as a GameFound exclusive for backing Master Dater.

Name: Master Dater: Uncut
Description: 150 New Cards that are too hot to handle.

Name: The Heart of Cthulhu: Father Dagon Mystery Deck
Description: This is a new stand alone deck of 110 cards that can be seamlessly added to the original game. This deck adds new elements of mystery and mechanisms for fighting other players. This deck costs 5 integrity to draw from and is full of card types from the original 3 decks but introduces new mystery cards that make the game change dramatically.

Name: Match a Track
Description: Players demonstrate their animal track identification skills in in this card game.  Player take turns matching tracks to animals.  Guess are checked against a reference sheet.  The player who can match the most tracks to the correct corresponding animals wins.

Name: Ticket To Ride: Italia – Commemorazione Per il Centenario del Milite Ignoto 1921 - 2021
Description:
Limited, Not for sale edition issued by Asmodee with the authorization of Days of Wonders and the Italian Ministry of Defense. Commemorative Copy released at the Lucca Comics & Games 2021 event to commemorate "The Centenary of the Unknown Soldier", in honor of the Italian soldiers who fell and were dispersed in WWI. Includes Graphic changes on the map in honor of the Italian Ministry of Defense and 4 new destination maps containing the cities of AQUILEIA and LUCCA

Not available from retail outlets.

Edizione rilasciata da Asmodee con l'autorizzazione di Days of Wonders e il Ministero della Difesa Italiano. Copia Commemorativa non vendibile rilasciata in pochissime copie per l'evento Lucca Comics & Games 2021 per commemorare "Il Centenario del Milite Ignoto" . In onore simbolico a tutti i soldati italiani caduti e dispersi in guerra. Include Modifiche grafiche sulla mappa in onore del Ministero della Difesa Italiano e 4 Carte destinazione nuove contenenti le città di AQUILEIA e LUCCA

Name: Four Score
Description:
Four Score combines strategy and dexterity in a multidimensional space. Use wooden sticks to complete lines of four on both sides of the board to win. To claim victory at Four Score you will need a steady hand, a keen eye for blocking and a passion for strategy.

Our board has a modular, minimalist design and all game components are wooden, sustainable and environmentaly friendly.

Four Score has four rules:

     Red plays first and can play only on outer holes for their first move. 
     To win, you must complete a line of four on both sides of the board. Horizontal, vertical or diagonal will do the trick


ï»¿# Sticks can only be controlled from your side of the board    (no reaching in to the centre of the board to complete your move) 
ï»¿# If you dislodge a stick on your go, that stick is replaced and your turn is over
ï»¿Final note: in the rare event of a stalemate, if one player has competed a line of four on 1 side they are declared the winner

—description from the publisher

Name: Quaking Aspens
Description:
Quaking aspen is a species of trees that often propagates through its roots to form large, clonal colonies that all share a single root system. In this game, you will play as an aspen tree, spreading its roots to grow clones in order to become the best grove of Quaking Aspens.

The active player rolls all three dice and then claims one of those dice. The player to their left will then claim one of the remaining two dice. All other players (if any) will use the final die. 
Each player will then use their die value to connect a leaf to another, already circled leaf (or the start leaf). They will do this by finding a solid path containing their die value leading from a circled leaf to another leaf, drawing a line over the path, and circling the new leaf. 
Each time a player circles a leaf, they gain the benefit of that leaf, which will either be a bonus or a scoring opportunity. These benefits will be tracked on your tracking mat. 
The game will be played in rounds, with all players taking simultaneous turns, until a single player has reached any 4 of the goal leaves. All players will finish the current round and then proceed to scoring.

Name: 0-100 Orange
Description:
A trivia game where you have to answer with a number ranging from 0 to 100. Answers can be in length, width, height, temperature, speed, size, age and given in units like centimeters, years, hours, crowns etc. The game differs from other trivia games which are often limited by given answer options.

The game is played in three rounds, consisting of seven questions each. The player with the lowest score at the end of the game is the winner.

There are a total of 1079 unique questions.

Name: La Frontera
Description:
La Frontera is a co-operative game for two players in which one player represents the migrants, a group of people who for different reasons have had to leave their country and seek to settle elsewhere. The other player takes on the role of an NGO whose mission is to facilitate the entry of migrants. Both players must work together, taking care of their confidential information, so that the greatest number of migrants reach the Residence, avoiding bureaucratic, political, social, and economic obstacles before it's too late.

—description from the publisher

Name: Smart10: Fotbolls-EM
Description: Fifty new cards with 100 new questions and 1,000 new answers about the European Football Championship.

Name: Die Kolonisten
Description:
The players alternately place a cardboard strip, beginning with the double red bordered harbor square, which must be filled first; this is followed by the 5 squares of the port city, then the 3 of the track. When all of these squares are closed, each player can place his strips anywhere on the board. Exceptions are the gold fields marked with a red dashed border, which may only be occupied when the red border of the mountain squares surrounding them is occupied. Furthermore, the inner lines of the farms may only be occupied when the red border is completely closed.

As often as a player manages to close a square with four of his stripes, he may place markers of his color in this square, namely 2 markers each in the port city, on the railway line and on the mountains, 3 on the red-bordered farms, on the gold fields 5, on all other squares one each.

If a player succeeds in enclosing a small group of fewer than 16 of his opponents stripes in such a way that he can no longer establish a connection with a group nearby, he can remove these stripes and the latter may not occupy these lines again.

When all lines are occupied or one of the players can no longer place a strip, the game is over. Whoever has placed the most markers is the winner.

Name: Tåg till Rydsgård (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description: Tåg till Rydsgård, Skåne is a fan-made expansion for the Days of Wonder board game Ticket to Ride. It is a partially almost entirely correct reproduction of existing, or previously existing, train lines in the southern-most part of Sweden (Scania and its closest neighbours).

Name: Rescue at Mt Etna
Description:
A daring rescue mission! During a regular hiking trip, Mt. Etna suddenly becomes active. The access road is blocked and hikers are trapped. Your mission: fly your helicopters into the volcano to rescue the hikers before the advancing lava reaches them.

This game stresses crisis planning, risk-taking, and cooperation. Three separate lava advances are controlled by dice, and hikers run from the advancing lava. Some locations in the volcano are easier to land in than others. Eventually the lava will fill the crater, and any hikers trapped will perish. Pilots who crash into the volcano must also be rescued. It is a race against the lava!

Players use dice to simulate the difficulty of flying in tricky conditions. Helicopters can be upgraded with power-ups and individual pilot cards grant special abilities. The overall victory is cooperative, but points are also awarded individually for a best pilot award.

This is a great game for introducing the importance of cooperation, teamwork, and risk taking in life-and-death situations. The situation is simulated but tension is real.

—description from the designer

Name: Ed & Wolf
Description:
Ed and Wolf accidentally invent a magic potion that turns the plants into moving, talking creatures. From that moment on, their new friends need special elements to stay alive. Every night, Ed and Wolf sneak out to gather all the important ingredients. The time is short and the locations can only be revealed one by one. Help them in their nighttime quest: find everything the plants need and return to Ed's room before it is too late!

—description from the publisher

The players have to consider every movement and situation as a puzzle to solve. The goal is to cross the garden, walk through the house, moving from one tile to another, meanwhile you have to spare your Time Cards, collect special ingredients and save as many plants as you can. …and: return to Ed’s room before your Time Cards run out.

—user summary

Name: Marvel HeroClix: Marvel Studios' What If…? Disney+ Miniatures Game
Description:
Experience the events of Marvel Studios What If…? like never before in this smash hit Miniatures Game standalone experience. “What If…?” flips the script on the MCU, reimagining famous events from the films in unexpected ways! Play with your favorites such as Captain Carter, T’Challa Star-Lord, and Party Thor!

Play up to 8 campaign scenarios unique to this Miniatures game for 2 players where results matter from session to session or sit down for a head-to-head single match of raw power! Each of the 10 beautiful ready to play figures comes with two different ways to play for hundreds of different combinations. Excellent point of entry for the first-time miniatures player! Map components are thick double-sided tiles and the box includes everything you need to play!

This miniatures game contains everything 2 people need to play HeroClix:

A meaty multi-session campaign for 2 players that pivots and turns based on the results of the last session
10 Premium Quality Pre-Painted Miniatures each with TWO ways to play for beginner or advanced play
20 Character Cards (one each for beginner and advanced versions)
18 Object, Terrain, and Bystander tokens
8 Campaign Scenario Cards
6 Double-Sided Thick Map Tiles. No folds!
2 Custom six-sided dice with an icon of The Watcher
2 All-new Powers and Abilities Cards with Marvel Studios What If…? imagery
1 Full-Color HeroClix Core Rulebook (2022 edition)

This boxed-set is a great way for 2 players to learn HeroClix or just enjoy a themed gaming experience! Existing players will definitely want to pick up this product to play with their friends or at tournaments!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Air Sloop
Description:
In Air Sloop you play the role of the captain of a sleek and fast air ship called an Air Sloop. You will travel to acquire goods which you use to fulfill orders and earn gold.  The Air Sloop Captain with the most at the end of the game is the winner.

Air Sloop is played over several rounds.
Each round consists of each captain taking one turn.
Each captain performs one action each turn.
Turns proceed clockwise, beginning with the starting captain.

Core Loop

When it is your turn, you must do one of the following actions:

MOVE: Choose one column in your cargo hold. Pilot your air sloop to adjacent districts based on the number of open spaces in the column you choose. Take goods from each district you visit. You may not visit the same district twice during one turn. Captains may also land on a contract card to (fulfill)

BUY: Use gold to buy a stock

End of Game

The end of the game is triggered once one captain has exchanged gold for their THIRD (3rd) AND FINAL CONTRACT CARD.

All captains then take turns so that all captains have an equal number of turns.

Determining a Winner

The winner is the captain who has the most gold.  Total gold is calculated by totaling up the following:


     The total gold earned by the captain.
     The cost of each contract card bought by the captain.
     Gold earned by cargo remaining in a cargo hold by the text on the captain’s bought contract cards.

Name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Deep – Baby Kaiju Promo Card
Description:
A special promo card included with all copies of The Deep (KS). This card is a bit too over-the-top to include in the retail edition. It's a really fun card for wild combos, and great for lighter games. Digital version will be available as well.

Power: 0. You may swap hands with another player.

Name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: Attack of the Baby Koalas
Description: A 6 card expansion for The Dark and The Deep (12 cards total) that expands the game for 4-6 players. It consists of 4 0 point cards, 1 13 point card, and a new thing.

Name: The Band Card Game
Description:
The Band is a card game easy to learn and fast to play. The goal of the game is to form your own band (singer, guitarist, bassist, drummer), but watch out for other players: they will have the same goal as you! Opponents will be able to get in your way with fierce Groupies, Producers ready for anything and unscrupulous Head Hunters. Don't worry, though: your Bodyguards will protect you from any malicious player.

Draw from the main deck and play as many cards as you want. The cards you play go into your personal discard pile, called the backstage pile. If you draw an event you skip the turn and suffer (or all players suffer) the effects of the event. Events discard onto a common discard pile and cannot be owned by players. You must have a maximum of 4 cards in your hand to end your turn. If you have more, you can discard the excess cards to the backstage (without using them) and pass the turn. The first to form a complete band wins!

Name: Maize Craze
Description:
In Maize Craze, players will simultaneously roll and place dice on their player boards attempting to match various maze paths shown on a card in the center of the table.

The game is played over the course of six rounds.

You earn points based on correctly placed dice and receive a bonus for being the first to exit the maze.

The player with the highest score is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: FUSS
Description:
The nightmare of a few teenagers in a suburban housing estate comes true when on a weekday evening walk they see an alien spaceship landing at the end of their street. The kids have no idea what are the aliens up to but the situation seems to be serious, so they need to run away and it might be a good idea to warn the neighbours that something is going on! Players are moving on a board from point to point and try to avoid aliens who are after them, while they try to alert the residents.

—description from the designer

Name: Sans Pitié
Description:
A game in the tradition of Cards Against Humanity.
One player is the master of the round and reads out the text of a red card. All other players now each secretly select a black card. Those black cards are shuffled and read out as responses to the red card. The master of the round decides which response is funniest and the player who chose that card receives a point.

—user summary
